metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3707 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: The icmp_check_sysrq function in net/ipv4/icmp.c in the kernel.org projects/rt patches for the Linux kernel, as used in the kernel-rt package before 3.10.0-327.22.1 in Red Hat Enterprise Linux for Real Time 7 and other products, allows remote attackers to execute SysRq commands via crafted ICMP Echo Request packets, as demonstrated by a brute-force attack to discover a cookie, or an attack that occurs after reading the local icmp_echo_sysrq file.

notes.Note: sbeattie> only affects kernels with PREEMPT_RT applied and enabled, which is not the case in Ubuntu kernels.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
